Skin Examination.purpose: Assess characteristics of erythematous nodules caused by ENL

content.content: Multiple tender erythematous nodules observed on arms and thighs, typical of Erythema Nodosum Leprosum. No new anesthetic patches found.

Skin Examination.interpretation: Findings are consistent with Type 2 leprosy reactions (ENL).

Joint Examination.purpose: Evaluate swelling and tenderness in joints

findings.content: Mild swelling and tenderness noted in wrists and knees with reduced range of motion.

Joint Examination.interpretation: Joint pain and swelling are likely related to systemic inflammation due to ENL.

Vital Signs.purpose: Monitor patient's vitals for fever and overall stability

findings.content: Vital Signs: Temp: 99.8°F, HR: 92 bpm, BP: 128/78 mmHg.

Vital Signs.interpretation: Low-grade fever consistent with systemic inflammatory response.

Eye Examination.purpose: Check for signs of iritis associated with ENL

findings.content: Eyes appear normal with no signs of redness or pain; no evidence of iritis.

Eye Examination.interpretation: No ocular involvement noted, indicating low risk for ocular complications at this time.

Palpation of Peripheral Nerves.purpose: Assess nerve tenderness that may indicate leprosy complications

findings.content: No acute tenderness noted in peripheral nerves during examination.

Palpation of Peripheral Nerves.interpretation: Peripheral nerves appear normal; no acute leprosy complications detected.

findings.content: Sensory examination unchanged from previous assessments; no new neural deficits.

Sensory Examination.interpretation: No new anesthetic patches noted; sensory function largely intact.

Complete Blood Count (CBC).purpose: Assess leukocytosis and anemia in ENL
Complete Blood Count (CBC).interpretation: Leukocytosis suggests systemic inflammation, mild anemia present.

Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR) and.purpose: Evaluate levels of inflammation in response to ENL
Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR) and.interpretation: Both ESR and CRP are elevated, indicating significant inflammatory activity consistent with ENL.

Liver Function Tests (LFTs) and Renal Fu.purpose: Assess baseline organ function prior to potential treatment with steroids
Liver Function Tests (LFTs) and Renal Fu.interpretation: All liver and renal tests within normal ranges, suitable for steroid therapy.

Blood Glucose.purpose: Monitor blood sugar levels before starting steroid therapy

results.content: Blood glucose level is 90 mg/dL, within normal limits.

Blood Glucose.interpretation: No contraindication for steroids based on blood glucose level.

Slit-Skin Smear.purpose: Track Bacterial Index for leprosy, not specifically for ENL diagnosis

content.content: Smear shows moderate presence of acid-fast bacilli consistent with leprosy diagnosis.

content.caption: Slit-skin smear with moderate presence of bacilli.

Slit-Skin Smear.interpretation: Presence of bacilli supports the diagnosis of leprosy but is not indicative of ENL severity.

Autoimmune Screen.purpose: Rule out other rheumatological causes for symptoms

results.content: Autoimmune screen negative; no autoimmune disorders detected at this time.

Autoimmune Screen.interpretation: No association with autoimmune conditions; reinforces diagnosis of ENL.
